1:
Praise Yahweh,\q for it is good to sing praises to our God,
\q it is pleasant, and praise is suitable.


\q
2:
Yahweh rebuilds Jerusalem,\q he gathers together the scattered people of Israel.
\q
3:
He heals the brokenhearted\q and binds up their wounds.


\q
4:
He counts the stars,\q he gives names to all of them.
\q
5:
Great is our Lord and awesome in power,\q his understanding cannot be measured.


\q
6:
Yahweh lifts up the oppressed,\q he brings the wicked down to the ground.
\q
7:
Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving,\q sing praises to our God with a harp.


\q
8:
He covers the heavens with clouds\q and prepares rain for the earth,
\q making the grass to grow on the mountains.
\q
9:
He gives food to the animals\q and to the young ravens when they cry.


\q
10:
He finds no delight in the strength of a horse,\q he takes no pleasure in the strong legs of a man.
\q
11:
Yahweh takes pleasure in those who honor him,\q who hope in his covenant faithfulness.


\q
12:
Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem,\q praise your God, Zion.
\q
13:
For he strengthens the bars of your gates,\q he blesses your children among you.
\q
14:
He brings prosperity inside your borders,\q he satisfies you with the finest of wheat.


\q
15:
He sends out his commandment to earth,\q his command runs very swiftly.
\q
16:
He makes the snow like wool,\q he scatters the frost like ashes.


\q
17:
He dispenses the hail like crumbs,\q who can withstand the cold he sends?
\q
18:
He sends out his command and melts them,\q he makes the wind to blow and the water to flow.


\q
19:
He proclaimed his word to Jacob,\q his statutes and his righteous decrees to Israel.
\q
20:
He has not done so with any other nation,\q and as for his decrees, they do not know them.
\q Praise Yahweh.
